attributes.comment:
With all respect, UCSS is very slow and inefficient.
In many instances, UCSS does not meet the timeframe required
by the law. If UCSS itself fails to comply with the law, what
message does it send?

I understand that one of the reasons stated for fee increase is
improving customer service and reducing backlogs.
Past experience with UCSS in this regard is quite dissappointing.

I suggest the following:

If the UCSS completes processing within the timeframe, it keeps
the fee, or else it should return the processing fee (or at least
a fraction of it). I think UCSS is currently doing this for premium processing.
I think that should be extended to ALL processing.

I oppose any fee increase that is not tied to improvement in service.

Respectfully Submiited.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Anonymous
